section.title: Bond Vocabulary
section.p: We begin this chapter by looking closer at how bonds work and the associated vocabulary and notation. We will unveil this in layers to avoid overwhelming the reader. As you learn more about bonds, it helps to remember that this is a cash stream of coupon payments with a principal repayment at the end, all valued using an interest rate.

introduction.p: We will begin with the basic payments. There are periodic payments called coupon payments (like the interest on a loan)The word "coupon" comes from an earlier practice, where a bond was represented by a certificate, and there was a book of "coupons" attached that the bondholder would bring to the bank to exchange for payment., and an amount called the redemption amount paid with the last coupon payment. This cash flow is valued at an interest rate, called the yield rate.

task.p: Suppose a bond has ten coupon payments of 50, with a redemption amount of 1000. Generate a timeline for this bond.
Use an effective yield rate of 6% to find the present value of this bond.

introduction.p: The coupon payments are calculated by multiplying a rate, called the coupon rate (expressed as a percentage), by an amount called the face value of the bond. Often, but not always, the face value and redemption amount are the same. So the coupon rate is like an interest rate on a loan, and the face amount is like the principal, and the yield rate is a market interest rate used to value the cash stream.

introduction.p: We have a few final definitions, as well as some assumptions, to introduce.

li.p: The time to the final payment is called maturity, and when the final payment occurs, the bond is said to have matured. This is often measured in years.
When F=C, we often say that the bond is a par-valued bond, or a bond that is redeemed at par.
When the frequency of coupon payments is unstated, they are assumed to be semiannual.
Unless otherwise stated, coupon rates and yield rates are quoted as nominal rates, convertible at the same frequency as the coupon payments.
